p: Alkaloids are a structurally diverse class of secondary metabolites whose key feature is a basic nitrogen (nitrogen in a negative oxidation state) in a carbon ring. They are classified according to their principal C-N skeleton into pyrroles (A1), pyrrolines (A2), pyrrolidines (A3), pyrrolizidines (A4) indoles (A5), pyridines (A6), pyrimidines (A7), piperidines (A8) quinolines (A9), isoquinolines (A10), quinolizidines (A11), tropanes (A12), imidazoles (A13) ( Figure 1). They can also be classified according to their biological origin. Alkaloids are widely distributed in plants and some animal species. For many years, plant alkaloids have been utilized in the treatment of various health conditions (Bribi, 2018).
